title: Phrack World News Issue 25
historical_context: This issue marks the 25th anniversary of Phrack, a significant milestone in hacker culture and the dissemination of underground information.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: This anniversary issue features a variety of articles covering topics from the KGB hackers to an interview with Pengo, along with updates on the SummerCon '89 and the new TAP Magazine.
summary:
In this special 25th anniversary issue of Phrack, Knight Lightning presents a collection of articles that reflect the vibrant and evolving landscape of hacker culture in 1989. The issue includes a detailed overview of the newly launched TAP Magazine, which aims to revive the spirit of its predecessor by providing accessible information to the hacking community. The TAP staff discusses their plans for funding, article submissions, and the importance of printed material in an increasingly digital world. Additionally, the issue highlights the ongoing battle between Southwestern Bell and bulletin board operators, showcasing the tensions between telecommunications companies and the burgeoning hacker community.

The issue also features notable news stories, including the plea bargain of infamous hacker Kevin Mitnick, who faced charges for computer fraud and unauthorized possession of long-distance codes. This case exemplifies the legal challenges faced by hackers during this era, as well as the evolving nature of computer crime. Other articles cover various incidents of fraud and theft, such as two men arrested for looting payphones and a young bank cashier who exploited lax security to commit fraud. Overall, this issue serves as a snapshot of the hacker culture at the time, encapsulating the challenges, innovations, and community spirit that defined the era.
